intro: Monanthotaxis letouzeyi, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Monanthotaxis letouzeyi is often found in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
